reviews.review: This Game is essentially Murder: The Hide and Seek Video Game. You have two sides in each match, survivors, and killers. One killer hunts down four survivors, and one killer has to do the job as such. They(The survivors) don't get any weapons and will have to escape using perks (skills, running faster for 3 seconds with a 40-60 second cooldown) or items like flashlights (blinds and stuns the killer so he can't see you run away for around 5 seconds or so.) They can also drop what are called 'pallets' onto killer players which are found in tight corners or open spaces to give more distance, as the killer has to spend time breaking it or going around to get to you again. However, they do have an advantage. The second that you run you leave little red 'scratch marks' on the ground that lead the killer to you. Most of the time when you are hit, you will be put into the wounded state, meaning you limp around while crying and drop blood, the killer can follow that blood directly to you, so the main job is to hide and not be found, as the longer you're chased the more disadvantages you'll have (Such as the killer attaining bloodlust, which makes him move way faster, on top of them already moving faster than you in the first place). It's not designed to be a fair 1v1 experience, it's designed to be a 4v1, and as such the killer is much stronger than a survivor and as such can easily beat them after a short time and put on a hook. If you get hung on a hook you have a certain amount of time to get off before the game kills you. Known as 'stages' each time you're on the hook you'll progress a stage, or if you're on too long. There's three stages. The first you can get out of the hook with ease, the second you'll have to mash spacebar constantly to avoid going into three, someone will have to rescue you before you die. It's a VERY fun game with a wide variety of options and ways to have fun. Don't be worried about the 'toxic community' as the only time the enemy team can even talk to you is post-match if you're killer, and as survivor only for the first few seconds before the match starts. During the game no contact can be made by or to either side, making the tension and teamwork a requirement. I heavily recommend this game if you have friends and plan to play survivor, or if you don't and want to be a killer. Being a survivor alone isn't that bad. People say that you'll get tunneled (The only survivor the killer hunts) and die, and while this is true, it doesn't matter at all. What tactics are employed by either side are a part of the game (Save the occasionally patched exploit.) In all, this is a very fun game for people who casually play games, or people who seriously play games. It doesn't matter how you enjoy games, there's a place here for you. If you're concerned about salty or toxic people just don't read the pre/post-game chat and you won't see problems. (Yes, tbagging can happen to you as killer but in that case just camp their hook and kill them, as killer you have the option to do whatever you please with them, and 'winning' is entirely subjective.) Ranks are the only real 'reason' to win the game, if that's what you really want in a hide-and-seek game go for it. Bloodpoints will be rewarded either way, and the amount is based on the 'feats' you pull off in-game, not your rank nor rank up materials. The game is wonky and absolutely unfair to survivors/killers at times, but both sides always have options of dealing with this, there's no reason to complain about it, it's just fun. Play it for fun, not for ranking. It's a Hide and Seek game for crying out loud, just enjoy yourself!

Enjoy this game quite a bit. Very fun playing with friends as there are a lot of great plays you can do as survivors. Learning curve isn't too bad, just prepare to die a lot. Also, don't expect to live all the time either. It's more about having fun then expecting to win all the time.
